newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Some Sappi mills hit by sympathy strike.
newsitem.headline: Some Sappi mills hit by sympathy strike.

text.p: South African paper producer Sappi Ltd said on Monday that some of its operations had been affected by a 24-hour sympathy strike by the Paper, Printing, Wood and Allied Workers Union.

It said in a statement that the strike had affected Sappi's Stanger and Tugela mills in KwaZulu Natal, its Enstra mill in Gauteng and its Ngodwana mill and sawmilling operations in Mpumalanga province.
No disruption to either production or customer service was expected, Sappi said.
Monday's strike action arose out of an 11-week strike over wage negotiations at Sappi's Adamas mill in the Eastern Cape city of Port Elizabeth.

Sappi said the dispute at Adamas, where 167 workers have been on strike, had still not been resolved but that production had not been affected and supplies to customers remained normal throughout the period.
Sappi said that Adamas was the only mill where wage talks had not been settled. Further mediation is scheduled for Thursday.
